    Checks if the password contains a digit by calling the isDigit method apart of the Character class

    First checks if the password is valid.
    static boolean NoSameCharInSequence​(java.lang.String password)
    Checks if the password has the same character in a sequence by keeping track of the current character, previous character, and next character If the current character is ever equal to the previous character or next character then there is a sequence.

  • Method Details

    • getInvalidPasswords

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getInvalidPasswords​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> passwords)
      Iterates through every String Password in the ArrayList Passwords Calls isValidPassword on the current password. if the function call throws and exception then the exception message and password are added to a ArrayList dedicated to store invalid passwords After all elements are done processing, the invalid passwords array list is returned.
      Parameters:
      passwords -
      Returns:
      ArrayList
      Throws:
      LengthException
      NoUpperAlphaException
      NoLowerAlphaException
      NoDigitException
      NoSpecialCharacterException
      InvalidSequenceException

    • isValidPassword

      public static boolean isValidPassword​(java.lang.String password) throws LengthException, NoUpperAlphaException, NoLowerAlphaException, NoDigitException, NoSpecialCharacterException, InvalidSequenceException
      Calls Numerous Passwords checker utility functions to ensure the password passed is a valid password. If it is not then an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      password -
      Returns:
      boolean
      Throws:
      LengthException
      NoUpperAlphaException
      NoLowerAlphaException
      NoDigitException
      NoSpecialCharacterException
      InvalidSequenceException

    • comparePasswords

      public static void comparePasswords​(java.lang.String password, java.lang.String passwordConfirm) throws UnmatchedException
      Compares two passwords using the equals method apart of the String class Throws a Unmatched Exception otherwise returns from call.
      Parameters:
      password -
      passwordConfirm -
      Throws:
      UnmatchedException

    • comparePasswordsWithReturn

      public static boolean comparePasswordsWithReturn​(java.lang.String password, java.lang.String passwordConfirm)
      Compares two passwords using the equals method from the String class. Returns true if the two passwords are equal. Returns false if they're not equal.
      Parameters:
      password -
      passwordConfirm -
      Returns:
      boolean

    • isWeakPassword

      public static boolean isWeakPassword​(java.lang.String password) throws WeakPasswordException
      First checks if the password is valid. Then checks if the password is weak by checking if the length is between 6 and 9 characters
      Parameters:
      password -
      Returns:
      boolean
      Throws:
      WeakPasswordException

    • NoSameCharInSequence

      public static boolean NoSameCharInSequence​(java.lang.String password) throws InvalidSequenceException
      Checks if the password has the same character in a sequence by keeping track of the current character, previous character, and next character If the current character is ever equal to the previous character or next character then there is a sequence.
      Parameters:
      password -
      Returns:
      boolean
      Throws:
      InvalidSequenceException

    • hasSpecialChar

      public static boolean hasSpecialChar​(java.lang.String password) throws NoSpecialCharacterException
      Uses regex to match standard alphanumeric characters in a string if there is no special characters then the match will be true so we not match
      Parameters:
      password -
      Returns:
      boolean
      Throws:
      NoSpecialCharacterException
